published_attributes.title: Introduction
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Welcome to Leader's Tools e-learning.

This learning is prepared for you to help you navigate most common tools used by our leaders to manage their teams.

TABLE OF CONTENT
  1. Calamari
  2. Salesforce / Source
  3. Bridge
  4. Toggl

Click continue to dive deeper into Calamari.

published_attributes.title: Bridge Learning
published_attributes.serialized_body:
MANAGERS

Managers in Bridge are assigned to learners who report directly to them. Managers are able to become more involved and have direct access to data and reports for how their employees are learning in Bridge. Manager permissions are scoped to the users, groups, and content within their domain.

Managers can:

  • View courses, programs, and live trainings in the account
  • View users and groups within their domain
  • View stats and reports for users within their domain
  • Enroll/unenroll learners in any course, program or live training in the account
  • Create and manage courses, programs, and live trainings within their domain

Notes:

  • Manager relationships are hierarchical. Other managers who report directly to you are inclusive of your domain thus, their users, groups, and content are also part of your domain.
  • Managers can also have an admin or account admin role that allows for additional permissions.
  • You cannot manually add managers in Bridge.
NAVIGATION

The primary global navigation menu, on the left hand side, will provide links to the different pages and tools for that application.

Me - this is where you will find all information on you as employee (learning, 1on1, development plan, goals etc).

Team - This is where you can access and track your teams learnings, meeting agendas, goals, feedback and more. This is where all your team member will be visible.

Company - This is where you can check org structure, find people and check company goals.

Author - This is where you create and distribute content to your employees.

Insights - This is where you can view insights and reports to make sure your learners are logging in and completing their courses.

Admin - This is where you can see a list of your users and groups. It also allows you to click on a user and view their My Learning page and also message them.

INGIGHTS

Insights is where you can view insights and reports to make sure your learners are logging in and completing their courses. Managers will only see learners under their domain. Admins will see all learners within their Bridge account.

Statistics can be found on the Insights page and can be filtered by four different time frames. Click the dropdown menu on the top left to change the time frame to last week, last month, last 3 months, or all time. This time frame will be applied to all statistics on the Insights page.

Team Completion Rate

The enrollment completion visualization chart will appear at the top of the Insights page. Please note that the chart will not be displayed if there are more than 250 learners in the account or managers domain. This chart gives you the ability to see a high level overview of how your learners are performing.

Each bubble on the graph represents a learner and the size of the bubble is proportionate to the total number of course enrollments. Admins and managers can hover over the learner bubbles to view the enrollment completion details popup menu. This menu includes the number of complete and overdue enrollments and the overall completion rate. It also includes the option to navigation straight to the Learner Details page to view the specific course enrollments and the option to message the learner.

View Completion Details

To view more details about the learner and their progress, hover over the learner bubble. The Enrollment Completion Details popup shows the number of completed and overdue enrollments for a specific learner. You can click the View Enrollments link to see the full detailed list of the learner's training content on their My Learning page and you can click the Message icon to message the learner.

Insights Page Reports Link

The Overdue and Completed Learners section will show the total number of Overdue learners and Completed learners. Clicking the Deep Dive button under the total will take you to the report that corresponds to the data. Within reports, you can access other reports, change the time frame and add filters to narrow down the data you are looking for. 

REPORTS

AUTHOR

The Author application is where you create and distribute content to your employees/learners.

The default page is the Courses page. You will see in the Global Navigation menu links to access Courses, Programs, Live Trainings, and Checkpoints.

As a Manager you can view all content, so you can enroll your learners in the trainings or checkpoints listed, however you will only have access to edit/delete the courses or content created by you or other users within your domain.

Tip: If you have access to courses, you can click the Summary tab for a course and see how well your required learners did for each quiz attempt.

Help Resources:

  • How do I use the Courses page?
  • How do I use the Programs page?
  • How do I use the Live Trainings page?
  • How do I use the Checkpoints page?

published_attributes.title: Toggl
published_attributes.serialized_body:
FOR UP TO DATE INFORMATION PLEASE ALWAYS CHECK THIS SPACE

HOW TO USE TUTORIAL:
BACKGROUND:

Toggl tool is one of the most important tools in our company. It not only tracks ones work time, but also contributes to the appropriate invoicing process. Yet, anyone that has ever tried to find anything in Toggl, knows that there are hundreds of Toggl projects and one can never be sure which one to use.

Due to the number of different options and the fact that there is no owner of Toggl data, the information gathered from reports on non-billable Toggl projects is incoherent and hard to rely on.

On top of that, even though most Toggl projects have sub-categories (tasks) that you can choose from, the majority of toggled hours are still put in the Without project section.

This is why we have recently started on a new cleaning project to simplify toggling and limit the number of internal Toggl projects.

WHAT CHANGES IN 2022:

After taking a closer look at current non-billable projects whether they were used commonly or individually, weve prepared a new closed internal projects catalog. We hope that it will help you allocate working hours in a more easy and pleasant way.

Please go here for more details on projects.

As you can see in the table, every cross-organization project has no sub-category (task) as we want to simplify the reporting process. When it comes to Team projects, it is totally up to you and your manager to decide whether you want to have sub-categories.

In addition, toggling on the Without project section will no longer be an option as we will turn on the setting that any new time entry must have a Project filled. On top of that, as of 3.01.2022 we will archive so far created internal projects.

All projects were consulted with the Core Team and then with a test group.

In order to easily find all official projects in toggl we added a client called netguru official projects.

!!! We are not changing the billable Toggl projects rules, however as a next step were looking into implementing some changes around naming and structuring them, to make Toggl cleaner and easier to use and analyse - we will keep you posted if and when any changes are introduced.

TIMELINE:

New projects will be imported at the end of this month, but an obligation to use them starts on January 1st, 2022. We believe that the beginning of the New Year is a perfect time for changes.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

WHY?

There are a few simple reasons behind the cleaning project:

  1. We want leaders to be able to see the data on working time of their team in order to better plan and manage workload.
  2. Even though we work on a task-based working system (zadaniowy czas pracy) we want you to be able to control and monitor your working time to keep your healthy work-life balance.
  3. This will allow us to make general rules around toggling, vacation registration etc. easier to follow and more unified across the company.
  4. Last but not least, it will help the Finance Team to gather financial data and predict costs and margin levels thoroughly.

WHO?

The obligation of toggling relates to the same group of Netgurals as it is now, but regarding our WHYs we strongly encourage everyone to use Toggl on a daily basis. Below you can find a simple summary.

  1. B2B contractors (beside flat-fee roles) - nothing changes for you in this part but please familiarise with the rearranged Toggl projects. At the same time we kindly remind you that requesting unpaid holidays in Calamari is obligatory as it also contributes to our cost predictions.
  2. UoP employees in billable roles - we strongly encourage you to toggl not only billable activities but non-billable as well. Toggling Bench and internal projects is particularly important from the financial and planning perspective. Please familiarise yourself with the rearranged Toggl projects.
  3. UoP employees in non-billable roles - we strongly encourage you to toggl your daily activities. Please familiarise yourself with the rearranged Toggl projects.
SUPPORT ON SLACK

Considering the fact that this change affects a lot of Netgurals, weve created a dedicated channel #toggl where you can ask questions regarding appropriate toggling. In addition, the catalog will be reviewed once per quarter and adapted, if needed.

Dear Team, thank you in advance for your cooperation and in case you have any questions, please feel free to contact fpa@netguru.com.

EXTRA TUTORAL:

  2. UoP employees in billable roles - we strongly encourage you to toggl not only billable activities but non-billable as well. Toggling Bench and internal projects is particularly important from the financial and planning perspective. Please familiarise yourself with the rearranged Toggl projects.
  3. UoP employees in non-billable roles - we strongly encourage you to toggl your daily activities. Please familiarise yourself with the rearranged Toggl projects.
SUPPORT ON SLACK

Considering the fact that this change affects a lot of Netgurals, weve created a dedicated channel #toggl where you can ask questions regarding appropriate toggling. In addition, the catalog will be reviewed once per quarter and adapted, if needed.

Dear Team, thank you in advance for your cooperation and in case you have any questions, please feel free to contact fpa@netguru.com.

EXTRA TUTORAL:

data.text: FOR UP TO DATE INFORMATION PLEASE ALWAYS CHECK THIS SPACE
Please go here for more details on projects.

blocks.text: FOR UP-TO-DATE INFORMATION PLEASE ALWAYS CHECK THIS SPACE
HOW TO USE TUTORIAL:
BACKGROUND:

Toggl tool is one of the most important tools in our company. It not only tracks ones work time, but also contributes to the appropriate invoicing process. Yet, anyone that has ever tried to find anything in Toggl, knows that there are hundreds of Toggl projects and one can never be sure which one to use.
Due to the number of different options and the fact that there is no owner of Toggl data, the information gathered from reports on non-billable Toggl projects is incoherent and hard to rely on.
On top of that, even though most Toggl projects have sub-categories (tasks) that you can choose from, the majority of toggled hours are still put in the Without project section.
This is why we have recently started on a new cleaning  project to simplify toggling and limit the number of internal Toggl projects.
WHAT CHANGES IN 2022:

After taking a closer look at current non-billable projects whether they were used commonly or individually, weve prepared a new closed internal projects catalog. We hope that it will help you allocate working hours in a more easy and pleasant way.
Please go here for more details on projects.

As you can see in the table, every cross-organization project has no sub-category (task) as we want to simplify the reporting process. When it comes to Team projects, it is totally up to you and your manager to decide whether you want to have sub-categories.

In addition, toggling on the Without project section will no longer be an option as we will turn on the setting that any new time entry must have a Project filled. On top of that, as of 3.01.2022 we will archive so far created internal projects.
All projects were consulted with the Core Team and then with a test group.
In order to easily find all official projects in toggl we added a client called netguru official projects.

!!! We are not changing the billable Toggl projects rules, however as a next step were looking into implementing some changes around naming and structuring them, to make Toggl cleaner and easier to use and analyse - we will keep you posted if and when any changes are introduced.
TIMELINE:
New projects will be imported at the end of this month, but an obligation to use them starts on January 1st, 2022. We believe that the beginning of the New Year is a perfect time for changes.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
WHY?
There are a few simple reasons behind the cleaning project:
We want leaders to be able to see the data on working time of their team in order to better plan and manage workload.
Even though we work on a task-based working system (zadaniowy czas pracy) we want you to be able to control and monitor your working time to keep your healthy work-life balance.
This will allow us to make general rules around toggling, vacation registration etc. easier to follow and more unified across the company.
Last but not least, it will help the Finance Team to gather financial data and predict costs and margin levels thoroughly.
WHO?

The obligation of toggling relates to the same group of Netgurals as it is now, but regarding our WHYs we strongly encourage everyone to use Toggl on a daily basis. Below you can find a simple summary.

B2B contractors (beside flat-fee roles) - nothing changes for you in this part but please familiarise with the rearranged Toggl projects. At the same time we kindly remind you that requesting unpaid holidays in Calamari is obligatory as it also contributes to our cost predictions.

UoP employees in billable roles - we strongly encourage you to toggl not only billable activities but non-billable as well. Toggling Bench and internal projects is particularly important from the financial and planning perspective. Please familiarise yourself with the rearranged Toggl projects.
UoP employees in non-billable roles - we strongly encourage you to toggl your daily activities. Please familiarise yourself with the rearranged Toggl projects.
SUPPORT ON SLACK

Considering the fact that this change affects a lot of Netgurals, weve created a dedicated channel #toggl where you can ask questions regarding appropriate toggling. In addition, the catalog will be reviewed once per quarter and adapted, if needed.
Dear Team, thank you in advance for your cooperation and in case you have any questions, please feel free to contact fpa@netguru.com.
EXTRA TUTORAL:
